Description: Shoulder and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed streaky black; exterior: alternating added red and black tongues at top of shoulder; below, black-figure decoration consisting of back of woman's head to left (hair, trace of added white on face and back of shoulder with red on garment remaining); upper half of Boeotian shield with white dots on rim, hanging by a thong; part of undetermined motif on right, perhaps edge of panel.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 266-7, no. B197)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0135) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 95-6, pl. III, no. 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
